item.title: Canadian Industry’s Roadmap for Real Change: “It’s Not About Statements. It’s About Measurable Progress” (Exclusive)
item.description: Black Screen Office CEO Joan Jenkinson, who spoke with THR at The Hollywood Reporter’s Access Canada Summit, is set to unveil an Anti-Black Racism Policy Framework.

item.title: How They Make the Mario Kart-Style 'Ghost Car' for Auto Racing Broadcasts
item.description: Watch a Formula 1, Nascar, or IndyCar race and you’ll see a “ghost car” overlayed atop the real-life image. The sensors used to create it also collect heaps of data that teams can access and study.

item.title: A New Reality Show About Virgins Highlights Why Gen Z Isn't Having Sex
item.description: Hulu’s Are You My First? joins a string of shows about virgins, as more young people open up about how the gender divide is impacting their sex lives.

item.title: In 'Alien: Earth', the Future Is a Corporate Hellscape
item.description: Alien: Earth creator Noah Hawley tells WIRED he imagined the planet’s future based on his fears as a parent about the present, from dystopian capitalism to the “moral horror” of growing up.

item.title: Paramount Has a $1.5 Billion ‘South Park’ Problem
item.description: The White House says the show is “fourth-rate” after it showed Trump with “tiny” genitals. The controversy comes just as the FCC has greenlit Paramount’s merger with Skydance and promised to end DEI.
